Container.Name: Anaconda3
Container.Overview:
This installs the Anaconda 3 Docker as published by Continuum Analytics on Dockerhub.
Once finished, open the token-link shown in the LOG.
After installation, it runs the following command:
``` conda install jupyter -y --quiet && \ mkdir -p /opt/notebooks && \ jupyter notebook \ --notebook-dir=/opt/notebooks \ --ip='*' \ --port=8888 \ --no-browser \ --allow-root \ --NotebookApp.token='' \ --NotebookApp.password='' ```
The first part of this command is also listed under continuumio/anaconda3 (tested for tag: 2023.07-1) and the last two lines are addded to avoid issues with token and password requirements. This makes the notebook server "open", which is why it's recommedned to implement additional security/authentication measures.
Container.PostArgs: conda install jupyter -y --quiet && mkdir -p /opt/notebooks && jupyter notebook --notebook-dir=/opt/notebooks --ip='*' --port=8888 --no-browser --allow-root --NotebookApp.token='' --NotebookApp.password=''
